name: saint
text: do not play this while smiling as it will ruin the song. you must have madness in your heart for it to show life has become too much for her.

name: atticusonline
text: ...or has it?

name: aargh
text: I play this feeling nothing but anger and emptyness . Does anyone know who wrote this?

name: gormster
text: I'm not sure the half-arsed keyboard was necessary. Other than that, nice guitar sound.

name: aargh
text: Yeah, it sucks. I didnt notice until ufter I uploaded it that I was playing the wrong thing, which is kind of annoying. Also, it's actually an electric guitar faded in and out.

name: bookofsand
text: "Play with Great Madness in your Heart" is either a great personal motto or a crappy name for a college band.

name: aaron_haynes
text: Or a great name for a crappy college band!

name: simms
text: I still prefer "to be performed relentlessly and without break."

name: huber
text: the world will always need people who buy magazines about car stereos - best insult ever

name: centipede_damascus
text: I have used this one in actual circumstances and can confirm it is quite effective.

name: catachresis
text: Almost as good as LN's eyes as the line is delievered. Lesson #1 In How To Express "Whatever, Fag" With Two Dots And Two Lines

name: fancyrat
text: He uses the same eyes when he's dealing a few panels later. Curious.

name: beansdooma
text: i think theres a subtle reference on showbiz here

name: spinynorman
text: That or Onstad genuinely dislikes those types of people.

name: mulisha7
text: Oh yeah, That's absolutely tops. In the great tradition of Achewood insults. That one reigns supreme.

name: thesoulbear
text:
I used to have SO MUCH FUN playing with Lego Starwars.

ESPECIALLY the Scout Troopers as they raced through the treacherous foliage of Endor's Forest Moon. They always killed Luke Skywalker, and then reigned down speedy, hot death on all the Ewoks.

Those were the days.

name: poodlelucy
text: those of us who work in public education refer to these people as ones who "will someday pump gas."

name: thesoulbear
text: At self-service stations.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: just hoping they will get tipped for it

name: hadakang
text: Teodor isn't used often enough, but he's always great.  And the fact that he's buying weed from Lil' Nephew while they insult eachother is even better.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Damn, I'm slow.

name: greyfield
text:
I myself am quite fond of adding dried oregano to my dishes.

And weed.

name: satellitetv
text: Onstead has a thing for rickenbakers

name: biddlebubbly
text: A comment left by biddlebubbly was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by dayvancowboy, erributtz, usversusthem)

name: goro
text: Don't you?

name: serf
text: little nephew is such a bastard

name: zem
text: I love their little code-talk exchange.

name: cousinted
text: It is a flawless code, they are like a pair of wind-talkers.

name: rowboat
text: I used to work at a super market. The guy in the meat department was my hook-up. We had a fairly elaborate code involving certain cuts of meat and amounts of weed. Example 1: butt steak = 1 oz. of the good shit. Example 2: tripe = nickle bag of whatever. We would do the deal right there in the meat locker, amongst the hanging carcasses.

name: tourach3
text: why in the fuck of everything great am i the first to chubby this?

name: bourbonsamurai
text: there ya go, i chubbied it, calm down my man. have a toke of tenderloin.

name: jawsh
text:
My friend has similar code for drugs
He works at a record store so he uses bands as codewords for scoring different things

Bob Marley or Sublime is for weed
The Beatles can get you acid
Jefferson Airplane turns up mushrooms

name: rowboat
text: I can only hope that if I walked into your friend's record store, he'd understand that by asking for some Ween, I actually wanted a bong hit of Scotchguard.

name: meetzorp
text: I just cackled out loud at the notion of takin' a bong-hit of Scotchguard.  Moreover, the association of Ween with such has made my afternoon.

name: rowboat
text:
[IMGS OFF]
I have to imagine that it made many of their afternoons, as well. Not that they'll ever remember.

name: relaxing
text: I have it on good authority that huffing scotchguard leads to scotchguard coating your mouth and throat, which you later cough up in little plastic sheets.

name: thomgreenwood
text: You have no idea how hard I just chubbied you.

name: laserblade
text: This is why the Internet exists.

name: laserblade
text: Upon further reflection, it's the perfect thing to say, ever.

name: thommy_h
text: Whoa, I just got this strip... I'm as dumb as that cat child.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: ...i just realized what the hell happened here.

name: jonmw
text:
I was in the same boat, which just goes to show how far I am from the world of drugs.
But I got it on my second journey through the archives

name: smilebuddha
text: Can I interest you in a subscription to " Car Stereos Monthly ?"

name: jimts
text: It took me a while to get it too but when I finally did it became my favorite Achewood strip ever.

name: seven47
text: This is a great arc, but for my money this strip is the most underrated of this whole amazing pot story.

name: direhaggis
text: 150 seems a steep price for so little dried oregano.

name: zeal
text: 150 for a 1/2 ounce is about what oregano goes for around here.

name: the_stoned_one
text: I can get you half an ounce of dried oregano

name: jetsam7
text: 150.  Same as in town.

name: quantumcasaba
text:
150-170 can get you double that here.
But you cannot buy beer in a grocery store, this is a disadvantage.

name: glyphtheory
text: alt text: Cue old timers groaning about the price of a lid

name: sargasm
text: MAN that chicken recipe is going to be good when it gets here

name: tellumo
text: that depends on how much of LN's "dried oregano" you use beforehand.

name: vic_tarasko
text: Bless the baby angel who made days like tomorrow.

name: machegav
text: "In charge of", but a chubb regardless.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: And so begins the chicken recipe jokes...awesome.

name: rogergs
text: Man, Teodor's discreet scoring ritual would put a John Le Carre microfilm hand-off to shame.

name: rhino
text: It took me so long to get this strip, but it just made it that much better when I did.

name: jedijoel
text: What I find interesting, is despite currency differences, a half ounce costs quite the same in either Australia or America. This is something for Ray's upcoming trip. Hit me up Ray, hit me up.

name: euphemisms
text: keep in mind, much much cheaper in canada. or, not "much, much", but it's a hell of a lot when you're a broke college student.

name: pitseleh
text: That intro sounds an awful lot like the beginning of Basic Instinct 2.

name: relaxing
text: You watched Basic Instinct 2.

name: pitseleh
text: ::sigh:: I watched the first 10 minutes and that was all I could stomach.

name: henrythecad
text: I can confirm that that little piece sounds exactly like the intro to silent hill.

name: stuart
text: Every gay-ass MCR-type gothemo band these days wants to make their every video look like that intro.

name: goosey
text: Daaaamn. This must be the fourth time I've seen this one and I only just got it.

name: _cheesekayke
text: Man when Philippe grows up he is gonna start a lot of conversations with "I have a story to tell you about when I was five."

name: wittyname
text: I refuse to believe Phillipe will ever stop being five.

name: clever-nickname
text: i wish i knew guitar, just so i could play these tabs.

name: bovine
text: i was just playin this. it sounds sorta like 'dee doo, doo dee, dee doo dee, dah dee doo dee dah dee doo dee' etc

name: crawfomp
text: The great thing about Tablature is that you don't even need to know how to play guitar, or music at all.

name: lolcatdeluxe
text: A comment left by lolcatdeluxe was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by relaxing, thesyndicate88, werthog42)

name: epicurus
text: YES

name: empy
text:
At my school the code was asking if they had ADHD then offering to buy their ritalin.
They were pretty straightforward.

name: tenthman
text: i really wish there was a 4.5 rating i could give, this is so close to a five for me, but for some reason i don't even fully know i like to save 5s for the most special of occasions.

name: samuraieaux
text: 150 for 1/2 oz. is extremely accurate to the local prices.

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
That sounds like a sad place.
I've paid 60 for an ounce of nug.

name: rmj12345
text:
where do you live

i want to go there

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
GROANNNNNN..... 15 for a 3-finger bag in my day, yo.
3 fingers being == 1 full oz. American.

Of course, some folks sold actual oregano in matchboxes to noobs too.

name: blarghamagarky
text: This really is one of my favorite strips

name: possums
text: When I play through these tabs, I have to wonder what they sound like when Onstad plays them...

name: bob_lamonta
text: i'm gonna guess that this one sounds like great madness in his heart.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Onstad: The perfect people

name: deusoma
text: Charley Smuckles, you little bastard.

name: l_c_b
text: Nothing is going on here that couldn't have been done with a simple surreptitous transfer of bag and cash. Of course, the overly elaborate precautions are what make it so funny. I love the elaborate code talk for the transfer of half an ounce.

name: falseprophet
text: What I'm still wondering is: if dried oregano symbolizes weed, then what are the drugs that Teodor really wanted, symbolized by tomatoes?

name: mrslickster
text: the dried oregano doesn't symbolize the weed though.  It resembles it.  It is an italian weed substitute, invented to make the mediterranean smell fantastic.

name: thesoulbear
text: The sign will be that the Mediterranean is AWESOME.

name: mattfish
text: he was just specifying an amount and LN cleverly applied a metaphor for the ingredient itself

name: henrythecad
text:
Onstad has good taste in a guitar.

A fine guitar must be sturdy, and forthright.

It must contain pleasant weight.

name: carlyle
text: Like a woman.

name: stereo
text:
I was once that drug-addled starlet, and let me tell you, that car was a thing of beauty.

Until it hit the rocks.

name: jhunter
text: man it took me like three reads to realise Little Nephew was selling weed to Teodor. those panels were gibberish to me for many puzzling seconds. drummers need help with everything

name: doubleclef
text: He totally sold that bear some weed!

name: evilbobikus
text: I grew up in a town killed with paranoid religious folk, and thus it was pretty common to have the sort of parents that listened in on our phone calls, so we had to constantly come up with new codes to be able to set up our drug deals without them realizing.  This comic puts most of our code talk to shame though.

name: carlyle
text: That is retarded.

name: admiralpants
text: This is who we are; a celebrity who drives off a bridge in a car, her beautiful body filling up with water.

name: tbtabby
text: I'm so embarrassed. I thought they were actually talking about dried oregano because Teodor likes to cook.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: Who knows, they could be, nothing explicitly points to it being not oregano but certain substances.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: Teodor's method of insultation is simply the best, all so subtle sometimes you could imagine the insultee not noticing he is being insulted.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Teodor's house has a high R-factor insultation.

name: redheron
text: hahahaha, 150 for half an o? nice.

name: carlyle
text: LN's eyes in panel three make me smile.

name: rmj12345
text:
My lady friends and I typically use shampoo as a code word.

Like, "Hey, would you like to come over tonight and shampoo our hair? I have some salon-quality products right now."

Or, "Hey girl! What brand of shampoo do you use and where can I get some?"
"Well, all I've got right now is White Rain, but my friend has some Suave for $60 for a half-bottle."

This is better, though.

name: changuitotuerto
text: ...or has it? (Cornelius: Yes)
